conclusion: Analyze the v-t graph and collision information to determine initial distance.
Graph shows velocity-time relationship for both cars.
Car A starts with a velocity of 25 m/s at t = 0.
Car B starts with a velocity of 15 m/s at t = 0.
Both cars brake simultaneously, collision occurs at t = 20 seconds.
Both cars have the same final velocity after braking.
Car A's final velocity is 25 m/s.
Car B's final velocity is 15 m/s.
At t = 20 seconds, both cars have the same velocity of 25 m/s.
Initial distance calculated using formula: Initial Distance = Final Velocity^2 / (2 * Relative Acceleration).
Relative acceleration is the difference in initial velocities: 10 m/s^2.
Substituting values gives Initial Distance = 31.25 m.
Initial distance between the two cars before collision was 31.25 meters.
